meanings.definition: The act of making frills or gathering into frills.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the frilling on her dress, it made it look fancy.
meanings.sent2: The frilling on the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The frilling on the cake made it look like a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a frilling effect on everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The frilling on the edges of the tablecloth danced in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: The frilling on the collar of the shirt was delicate and pretty.
meanings.sent2: She added a frilling to the hem of her skirt for a playful touch.
meanings.sent3: The frilling on the puppy's ears made it look even cuter.
meanings.sent4: The frilling on the waves of the ocean sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The frilling on the pillow gave it a cozy and inviting look.

meanings.sent1: She carefully frilled the edges of the paper to create a decorative border.
meanings.sent2: The seamstress frilled the fabric to add a touch of sophistication to the dress.
meanings.sent3: He frilled his hair for the costume party, looking like a rockstar.
meanings.sent4: The wind frilled the leaves of the trees, creating a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The chef frilled the pastry edges to make the dessert visually appealing.
